Class Web

Web is the top-level static class for the 3D WebView plugin. It contains static methods for configuring the module and creating resources.

CreateVideoMaterial(Action<Material>)

Like CreateMaterial(), except it creates a material that a webview can use for rendering video on iOS. On other platforms, this method returns null.

Declaration
public static void CreateVideoMaterial(Action<Material> callback)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Action<UnityEngine.Material> callback

CreateWebView()

Creates a new webview in a platform-agnostic way. After a webview is created, it must be initialized by calling one of its Init() methods.

Declaration
public static IWebView CreateWebView()
Returns
Type Description
IWebView
Remarks

Note that WebViewPrefab takes care of creating and managing an IWebView instance for you, so you only need to call this method directly if you need to create an IWebView instance outside of a prefab (for example, to connect it to your own custom GameObject).

Examples
var material = await Web.CreateMaterial();
// Set the material attached to this GameObject so that it can display the web content.
GetComponent<Renderer>().material = material;
var webView = Web.CreateWebView();
webView.Init((Texture2D)material.mainTexture, 1, 1);
webView.LoadUrl("https://vuplex.com");

CreateWebView(WebPluginType[])

Like CreateWebView(), except an array of preferred plugin types can be provided to override which 3D WebView plugin is used in the case where multiple plugins are installed for the same build platform.

Declaration
public static IWebView CreateWebView(WebPluginType[] preferredPlugins)
Parameters
Type Name Description
WebPluginType[] preferredPlugins
Returns
Type Description
IWebView
Remarks

Currently, Android is the only platform that supports multiple 3D WebView plugins: WebPluginType.Android and WebPluginType.AndroidGecko. If both plugins are installed in the same project, WebPluginType.AndroidGecko will be used by default. However, you can override this to force WebPluginType.Android to be used instead by passing new WebPluginType[] { WebPluginType.Android }.

SetIgnoreCertificateErrors(Boolean)

By default, browsers block https URLs with invalid SSL certificates from being loaded. However, this method can be used to ignore certificate errors.

Declaration
public static void SetIgnoreCertificateErrors(bool ignore)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Boolean ignore
Remarks

Important notes:

Examples
void Awake() {
    Web.SetIgnoreCertificateErrors(true);
}

SetStorageEnabled(Boolean)

Controls whether data like cookies, localStorage, and cached resources is persisted between webview instances. The default is true, but this can be set to false to achieve an "incognito mode".

Declaration
public static void SetStorageEnabled(bool enabled)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Boolean enabled
Remarks

On Windows and macOS, this method can only be called prior to initializing any webviews.

Examples
void Awake() {
    Web.SetStorageEnabled(true);
}

Declaration
[Obsolete("Web.SetTouchScreenKeyboardEnabled() is now deprecated. Please switch to using the NativeOnScreenKeyboardEnabled property of WebViewPrefab / CanvasWebViewPrefab or the IWithNativeOnScreenKeyboard interface.")]
public static void SetTouchScreenKeyboardEnabled(bool enabled)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Boolean enabled

SetUserAgent(Boolean)

Globally configures all webviews to use a mobile or desktop User-Agent. By default, webviews use the browser engine's default User-Agent, but you can force them to use a mobile User-Agent by calling Web.SetUserAgent(true) or a desktop User-Agent with Web.SetUserAgent(false).

Declaration
public static void SetUserAgent(bool mobile)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Boolean mobile
Remarks

On Windows and macOS, this method can only be called prior to initializing any webviews.

Examples
void Awake() {
    // Use a desktop User-Agent.
    Web.SetUserAgent(false);
}
See Also
IWithSettableUserAgent

SetUserAgent(String)

Globally configures all webviews to use a custom User-Agent.

Declaration
public static void SetUserAgent(string userAgent)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String userAgent
Remarks

On Windows and macOS, this method can only be called prior to initializing any webviews.

Examples
void Awake() {
    // Use FireFox's User-Agent.
    Web.SetUserAgent("Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.15; rv:91.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/91.0");
}
See Also
IWithSettableUserAgent
